title: The Divine Feminine: Meaning, History, Traits, & More

steps.title: The divine feminine is the emotional and intuitive energy inside us all.
steps.content: The divine feminine is the emotional and intuitive energy inside us all. The divine feminine was born out of the idea that there’s a female equivalent to patriarchal, masculine social structures and deities. The divine feminine is believed to be the energy inside everyone that is associated with creativity, fertility, and intuitive thinking. [1] X Research source Throughout time, many cultures have celebrated divine feminine goddesses: the Egyptians had Isis, the Romans had Venus, and the Greeks had Aphrodite. Many religions have also embraced feminine counterparts to masculine gods. In Hinduism, the world’s oldest religion, female deities are still worshiped today. The divine feminine is the equal counterpart to the divine masculine—both work together like yin and yang to bring balance to our lives.

steps.title: Emotional and heart-centered
steps.content: Emotional and heart-centered The divine feminine is the more “right-brained” aspect of your personality that guides your emotions and allows you to listen to your inner feelings. Getting in touch with your inner divine feminine can help you allow yourself to feel your emotions instead of suppressing them.

steps.title: Intuitive
steps.content: Intuitive In your day-to-day life, you may find yourself making logical and rational decisions while suppressing your inner wisdom. The divine feminine can remind you to follow your intuition , reflect on your emotions, and listen to these “gut feelings” or “instincts” when you find yourself at a crossroads.

steps.title: Cooperative
steps.content: Cooperative Cooperation means working communally with others toward a common goal. The divine feminine is often described as the more extroverted, open parts of ourselves that know the value of working together and listening to others’ unique insights and contributions.

steps.title: Compassionate and sensitive
steps.content: Compassionate and sensitive The divine feminine is a nurturing, empathetic, gentile energy that is not only focused inward but outward toward the earth, animals, and other people. Those who harness the divine feminine also often find success in relationships and being kind to the people around them rather than through achievement or wealth.

steps.title: Sensual
steps.content: Sensual Being sensual means getting pleasure from the world around you and finding your body a wonderful place to live in. Instead of doing and achieving, you’re more focused on just being. The divine feminine can help you be more present, indulge in activities that excite you, and appreciate your body. Sensuality is not just about sex—instead, it’s more about taking time to enjoy your everyday life and being comfortable in your own skin.

steps.title: Creative
steps.content: Creative Creativity is an essential part of the divine feminine. Your dreams, fears, passions, thoughts, and feelings can seep into the beautiful work you create. This freedom of expression can be a great way to understand yourself better and get in touch with the feminine energy inside of you.

steps.title: Forgiving and accepting
steps.content: Forgiving and accepting The divine feminine can help you accept yourself and those aspects of life that you can’t change. Forgiveness towards yourself means letting go of what brings you stress and being understanding towards yourself. Allow yourself to find acceptance, softness, and kindness towards yourself, especially on difficult days.

steps.title: Cultures and religions across time have worshipped divine feminine figures.
steps.content: Cultures and religions across time have worshipped divine feminine figures. The divine feminine has always existed, although different cultures and spiritual traditions might have different ideas about what femininity means. Here are a few goddesses and figures that show how divine femininity can be powerful, complicated, and ever-changing: [2] X Research source Venus: The ancient Roman goddess of passion. Pele: The Hawaiian goddess of volcanoes, who is said to create new life after they erupt. Aphrodite: The ancient Greek goddess of love, desire, beauty, and sexuality. [3] X Research source Freyja: The ancient Norse goddess of love, fertility, battle, and death. [4] X Research source Oshun: The deity of the Yoruba people of southwestern Nigeria who is typically associated with water, purity, love, fertility, and sensuality. [5] X Research source Isis: The Egyptian goddess associated with healing and protection from this world to the afterlife. Guanyin: The Buddhist goddess (enlightened being) of compassion. She is the female counterpart to Avaloskitesvara. Durga (or Devi or Shakti): The Hindu goddess who is the female counterpart to male divinities and is often associated with protection, strength, motherhood, war, and destruction. [6] X Research source Asase Yaa (or Aberewa): The great female spirit of the earth in the indigenous religion of the Akan people of the Guinea Coast. She’s often associated with fertility, motherhood, and the creation of life. [7] X Research source Sophia: A central figure in Gnosticism, who represents divine wisdom and feminine spirit, and is believed to be the female counterpart to Jesus Christ. [8] X Research source The Shekinah: The Glory of God, and female counterpart to HaShem in Judaism. [9] X Research source

steps.title: People of all genders and sexes can embrace the divine feminine.
steps.content: People of all genders and sexes can embrace the divine feminine. Divine feminine and masculine energies don’t have anything to do with gender or sex. Everyone has the divine feminine inside of them. Instead of being opposed to each other, masculine and feminine energies exist in balance with each other like yin and yang or the sun and the moon. [10] X Research source Everyone has a mixture of these masculine and feminine qualities. While the divine masculine is achieving, confident, and logical, the divine feminine is more reflective, intuitive, and cooperative.

steps.title: Take care of your body and mind.
steps.content: Take care of your body and mind. Nourishing your feminine energy often means taking care of yourself and giving your mind and body what they need to survive and grow. Drink plenty of water, engage in exercise each day, get enough sleep, pray or meditate, and be kind and loving toward your physical body. [11] X Trustworthy Source National Institute of Mental Health Informational website from U.S. government focused on the understanding and treatment of mental illness. Go to source

steps.title: Love yourself for who you are.
steps.content: Love yourself for who you are. Trying to measure up to other people’s standards can put strain on your mental and emotional energy. Incorporate the divine feminine into your daily life by learning to love yourself for who you truly are. Forgive and accept your flaws, practice gratitude , and repeat positive affirmations to yourself daily. [12] X Research source

steps.title: Seek positive, uplifting, encouraging relationships.
steps.content: Seek positive, uplifting, encouraging relationships. Being compassionate towards yourself can mean searching for the wonderful kind friendships and relationships that you deserve. Look for people who recognize your value and will lift you up when you’re feeling low. Nurture your relationships and allow them to fill you with positive, loving energy.

steps.title: Get involved in climate change and social justice causes.
steps.content: Get involved in climate change and social justice causes. The divine feminine is an empowering energy that often means fighting for changes that can benefit the world and the people around you. Connection to Mother Earth and community are the foundations of the divine feminine—do your part to help the planet and support changes that will truly matter. In many cultures, the divine feminine is also associated with justice and defense. [13] X Research source Try to use your power to help those around you.

steps.title: Listen to your intuition for guidance before taking action.
steps.content: Listen to your intuition for guidance before taking action. Divine feminine energy is all about developing your intuition . By getting in touch with your inner voice, you may find that it’s easier to make decisions, in all aspects of your life. Pay attention to what your dreams might be telling you and keep a journal, taking 20 minutes a day to reflect on what’s on your mind. [14] X Research source

steps.title: Spend time outside in nature.
steps.content: Spend time outside in nature. Engaging in the natural world and all its sensations can help you get in touch with your inner feminine energy. Enjoy what the natural world has to offer by going for a walk, hiking, collecting flowers or other objects from nature, planting a garden , or caring for plants indoors.

steps.title: Sit in silence and give yourself a moment of rest.
steps.content: Sit in silence and give yourself a moment of rest. A constant barrage of work, social media notifications, and the general stress of life can be overwhelming to the senses. If you feel drained, fuel your feminine energy and give your soul a moment of healing by sitting by yourself without music or distractions for at least five minutes. You can also decorate your home with calming lighting, colors, and textures that bring you a sense of peace.

steps.title: Embrace wisdom, care, collaboration, and community in business.
steps.content: Embrace wisdom, care, collaboration, and community in business. The workplace is often seen as a field dominated by masculine energy. [15] X Trustworthy Source American Psychological Association Leading scientific and professional organization of licensed psychologists Go to source However, having a balance between masculine and feminine energies can make you an excellent leader. Bring more feminine energy into the workplace by encouraging group collaboration and supporting the achievements of others.

steps.title: Embrace your sensuality.
steps.content: Embrace your sensuality. Divine feminine energy encourages you to be comfortable in your own skin and celebrate the pleasant physical sensations you get from the world around you. Bring the divine feminine into your life by lighting your favorite candle, cooking a delicious meal, wearing nice fabrics, or listening to your favorite music.
